alert.note: Alert for Mississippi (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 26 at 1:24PM CST until March 12 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Tennessee...Arkansas...Missouri... Mississippi River at Caruthersville For the Lower Mississippi River...including Tiptonville, Caruthersville, Osceola, Memphis, Tunica Mhoon Landing, Helena... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO SATURDAY, MARCH 12... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Caruthersville. * WHEN...From this evening to Saturday, March 12. * IMPACTS...At 34.0 feet, In Tennessee, Barr Road along the Middle Fork of the Forked Deer River is flooding near the bridge at the south end of Watkins Road. Water from the north bottom of Lauderdale County is now flowing over the basin boundary into the south bottomm of Lauderdale County. In Missouri, large business just north of Caruthersville is beginning to flood. Many fields adjacent to the Interstate 155 bridge are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM CST Saturday the stage was 31.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 34.0 feet Friday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Friday, March 11. - Flood stage is 32.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
